snippet: “Snapshot: Painters and Photography, Bonnard to Vuillard,” at the Phillips Collection in Washington, shows how the early hand-held cameras freed painters to take pictures.
abstract: Karen Rosenberg reviews exhibition Snapshot: Painters and Photography, Bonnard to Vuillard at the Phillips Collection in Washington, DC.
lead_paragraph: “Snapshot: Painters and Photography, Bonnard to Vuillard,” at the Phillips Collection in Washington, shows how the early hand-held cameras freed painters to take pictures.

headline.seo: ‘Snapshot: Painters and Photography,’ at Phillips Collection
headline.main: For Artists, a Hand-Held Revolution of Point and Click
headline.print_headline: For Artists, a Hand-Held Revolution of Point and Click
